An Rmd file creating through a docker image of Rstudio (bcb420-laeticia-image).

1. create a 5 by 10 matrix of random integers
2. define column names as cond1, cond2, cond3, cond4, cond5, ctrl1, ctrl2, ctrl3, ctrl4, ctrl5
3. define row names as gene1, gene2, gene3 ...
4. compute the fold change for each gene.

```{r}
# initialise 5 x 10 random integers
rand_int <- sample(40, 50, replace = TRUE)

# create matrix from the random ints
gen_exp <- matrix(data = rand_int, nrow = 5, ncol = 10)

# define vector of column names
col_names <- c("cond1", "cond2", "cond3", 
               "cond4", "cond5", "ctrl1", 
               "ctrl2", "ctrl3", "ctrl4", "ctrl5")

# rename cols 
colnames(gen_exp) <- col_names

# define row names
row_names <- c("gene1", "gene2", "gene3", "gene4", "gene5")

# rename rows
rownames(gen_exp) <- row_names

# create a new df for fold changes
foldchange <- data.frame(row.names = row_names)

for (i in 1:5) {
  foldchange[paste0("cond", i)] <- gen_exp[,i] / gen_exp[,i+5]
}
  
gen_exp
foldchange
```
